qas.question: What role did Thailand play in the war?
Which group controlled Chinese costal regions?
Burma was formerly annexed by what country?
What states assisting Japan was Thailand a part of?
What year did Thailand form an alliance with Japan?
What were the Japanese puppet states?
Who controlled the coast of China?

context: The <a4_0>Axis<a4_0/> states which assisted Japan included the authoritarian government of Thailand in World War II, which quickly formed a <a0_0>temporary alliance<a0_0/> with the Japanese in <a5_0>1941<a5_0/>, as the Japanese forces were already invading the peninsula of southern Thailand. The <a2_0><a6_0>Phayap Army<a6_0/><a2_0/> sent troops to invade and occupy northeastern Burma, which was former Thai territory that had been annexed by <a3_0>Britain<a3_0/> much earlier. Also involved were the Japanese puppet states of <a7_0>Manchukuo and Mengjiang<a7_0/> (consisting of most of Manchuria and parts of Inner Mongolia respectively), and the collaborationist <a1_0><a8_0>Wang Jingwei regime<a8_0/><a1_0/> (which controlled the coastal regions of China).
